name: The Cottages of Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was charmed from the moment we pulled into this enclave. We were greeted so warmly, and I instantly felt at home when we entered our cottage (# 1). Really large, with galley kitchen, large sitting area, beautiful, comfortable bed, gas fireplace, large bathroom with a fabulous jacuzzi tube. Many of the features of the cottage are from original structures, including the beautiful peg and plank wood floors. My favorite part? It was a toss up between the amazing basket of Bouchon Bakery goodies, fruit, o.j. and newspaper delivered every morning or the chiminea and private seating area (complete with s'mores kit it you want it) that we enjoyed every evening.
reviews.title: Home away from home plus excellent "extras"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Oh, and the service. Concierge Kevin was most helpful with making (and changing!) dinner reservations for us. Sharon, the evening staff and driver, was extremely nice and knowledgeable. Did I mention complementary rides to area Yountville restaurants every night? What a nice idea to be able to go out to dinner in wine country, enjoy a bottle of wine and not have to worry about someone being the designated driver. Owner Mike stopped by a few times while we were enjoying our outside area to check that everything was going well.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, let's be honest. Yountville can be a little pretentious and yuppy. This welcoming, charming cottage setting is the perfect antidote. The facilities alone would probably earn it a five star in my book, but the extra service really puts it over the top. Thanks Mike and staff for a wonderful four days. We will be back, and will recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Best Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: The celebration of my husband's 60th birthday was amazing thanks to the Staff and the accommodations at The Cottages of Napa Valley. From the warm greeting upon arrival, bottle of wine chilled in your refrigerator to the linens, fireplaces... I could go on and on. A car service to and from our restaurants and a well planned wine tour package organized by the Staff just added to the relaxation factor. Thank you for making this the best weekend ever. We will be back!
reviews.title: Romance and high end comfort in central wine country locale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottage was absolutely lovely. There is a yard in the front and back entrances. There's a fireplace inside and outside in the front. Very warm and cozy. The little kitchen was a great add-on. You have all the utensils needed and wine glasses (of course!) The lodging seems low key but equipped with high quality products and facilities. They deliver breakfast from Bouchon Bakery to your door step every morning. They offer free shuttle service to a lot of restaurant nearby. (We gave our wonderful driver a good tip.) Tontville is where all the fancy dining is. Service was great and attentive. We were given a Smore kit for the fireplace outside. I will definitely come back next time.
reviews.title: Above & Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great four night stay at the Cottages for a 50th birthday celebration. Outstanding in every way as per the other reviews. Specially nice was that the pastries delivered every day were different (attention to detail) and the visit with Mike Smith the owner was a delight as we learned the origin of the Cottages. Our restaurant reservation and wine tour reservation were handled with ease. Tiny small detail was the sound of the fridge loud in comparison to the quiet of the place. Would definitely return and tell our friends!
reviews.title: Loved the Cottages!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the 5 star rating will not steer you wrong. We stated here for a wine tasting trip with friends and were blown away with this place! How could you go wrong with your own cottage, with heated bathroom floors, wine and water in the fridge, a basket of snacks, fresh pastries delivered for breakfast, a comfortable bed and fire place outside?? We did not want to leave and can not wait to re visit this paradise.
reviews.title: over 5 star quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from the Cottages after a stay to celebrate our 25th anniversary. All the other 5 star reviews are accurate to the smallest detail. The cottage was incredibly comfortable from the bed to the heated bathroom floor. The level of service and amenities offered are unique. It almost defies description as it is not a hotel nor is it a bed and breakfast. It is soooo much more. From complimentary transportation to and from the Yountville restaurants .....to the private patio where we enjoyed cheese and wine in the evening beside a fire ......to breakfast served each morning via picnic basket delivered to our front door filled with the best Bouchon Bakery had to offer, every expection was exceeded. Each person on staff wore a smile, displayed a willingness to assist with any request and it was obvious that they enjoyed working there as much as we enjoyed staying there. There is no other place we would stay in Napa after this experience and look forward to coming back soon!!!
reviews.title: Perfect retreat from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: The Cottages of Napa Valley was all I imagined it to be and more. It felt like I was in my own house, with lots of privacy and amenities. It had all the cm first I home with attention to high end details. The environment was quiet and very relaxing for my us, which is what we wanted out of our long weekend. The pairings package enabled us to try Ad Hoc which was such a superb experience. Our reservations at Paraduxx winery were effortless. The staff at the cottages were all friendly, approachable, but not intrusive. Location is central to all things Napa Valley. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Relaxing Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We stayed at the Cottages for a girls wine trip. From the moment we got there, we were taken care of. Our room was perfect, the staff (ask for Kevin) was knowledgeable, friendly and went out of their way to make our stay great! It was the perfect location (quiet but minutes from town). We had a fantastic time!!!! I am already planning a trip there again with my husband!!!!
reviews.title: The Cotteges were amazing for the Napa experience!'n

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Most places that we've stayed at didn't live up to the website pictures and description. The Cottages of Napa Valley lived up to every picture and expectation that we had see on the web. Very relaxing and peaceful. The bed was so comfortable and did I mention, the cottage was spotless. This place lived up to all our expectations and then some!! My new favorite place.
reviews.title: We found our perfect place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thank you for an outstanding experience both before and during our stay. I had reserved the Cottages car service in advance and asked for some help figuring out our schedule. Kevin the Conceriege worked with me on getting our wine tours set up in advance. Dawn at the front desk worked with me on some tricky arrival needs as I was taking friends to Napa as a surprise. My needs were complicated and the folks at the Cottages handled it all with ease. Craig drove us for our two days and did a wonderful job. When you look at the website, it is actually just as beautiful and pristine as it looks online. Simply enchanting place. I cannot wait to go back again.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a two night stay at The Cottages.
reviews.title: Great Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The property should almost be billed as an "all-inclusive". Once you arrive there, I doubt you have to spend any more money. So many places nickel and dime you every time you turn around.
reviews.title: Love it here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is what is included:
reviews.title: Once again, beyond our expectations!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved our stay here. The cottages were conveniently located and yet nice and quiet. The bed was comfy and the tub was amazing. Loved the outdoor fireplace. We will always stay here when we go to Napa
reviews.title: Love, love, love

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for a couple of nights at The Cottages of Napa Valley as part of our 10th anniversary trip. It's a lovely, romantic place to stay. Highlights included the fabulous pastries delivered around 8am to your doorstep, the warmth from the fireplace in the room, the spacious bathroom and the helpfulness of everyone that works at the cottages.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful place to stay...all thumbs up...they really have a great establishment and you see it in how they treat their guest. Very private, you never know when they come to clean...it just gets cleaned. I would highly recommend the cottages to anyone staying in Napa..we would not want to go anywhere else...it is truly a wonderful experience and I'm looking forward to my next visit in April 2013
reviews.title: Cottage 1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the Napa Valley Cottages! Have stayed several times. Brought a group of 5 couples for a three night stay, and everyone raved about it! Close to Yountville. Expensive, but worth it! Very friendly staff. Breakfast basket from Bouchon Bakery was teriffic!
reviews.title: Adorable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Cottages first week of February. Sat outside next to the private fireplace in the evening and morning with friends. Good location for visiting wineries during the day. Took a walk down the street of the quiet neighborhood. Modest and spectacular homes coexisting, each with a vinyard for a front yard. The Cottages made advance arrangements for an enjoyable wine tasting at Paraduxx. Some wineries are snooty, some have bad service. Paraduxx was execellent. Our Cottages package included dinner at Ad Hoc with car service. Very nice touch. Large rooms with couch and small kitchen. A microwave with built-in toaster (plus another toaster). Morning breakfast basket and coffee press took the edge off the previous day's wine tastings. Will be back.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the fireplace

aka: The Cottages Of Napa Valley Hotel Napa
description: we offer 8 king cottages, centrally located in the napa valley, 2 miles south of yountville. each cottage has a luxurious king bed, living room area, equipped kitchenette, gas fireplace, all in one room under a vaulted ceiling. wi-fi, HDTV, bose system for music players, are all included. the bathroom has heated tiled floors, shower, and a deep-soaking tub sized for two. the romantic king cottages include a jacuzzi tub, and separate walk-in shower.outside each cottage is your own fireplace stocked with wood each evening.a breakfast basket is delivered to the front porch each morning, with freshly baked pastries from Bouchon Bakery.your own home in the heart of the wine country!
